content: cozy chunky blanket a cozy chunky blanket that you literally knit by hand when you get close to the end of a skein of yarn knit one in an afternoon and get cozy tonight a simply tie a secure knot to connect the next skein - perfect gift or just for you no needles needed make sure the tails are each about 6 inches long see my youtube video tutorial here make sure the knot is on the back side as you https //youtu be/wjg1vj02e6e where i knit the whole continue knitting blanket in under 15 minutes with a little time enhancement help continue knitting until you have about 30 row make sure you have a length of yarn left that is about 4-5x size the width of your blanket 15-17 ft long this should be enough to cast-off approximately 45 inches wide by 58 inches long materials cast off can be done on either a row 1 or a row 2 knit 2 stitches super bulky/jumbo yarn approximately 140 yds pass the first stitch over the second stitch this casts shown here yarn bee eternal bliss yarn 28 yds per off the first stitch skein 100% polyester weight 8 oz colorway ivory knit the 3rd stitch five 5 skeins used in sample shown pass the second stitch over the third stitch this casts off the second stitch note if you are using a different type of continue in this manner with the remaining stitches - yarn look for one with a knit gauge 2 5 you will wind up with one loop left stitches x 3 5 row = 4 x 4 with us size 50 cut the yarn - leaving a 6-8 inch tail and pull the tail 25mm knitting needles or a crochet through the remaining loop and pull tightly gauge 2 single_crochet x 2 row = 4 x 4 with us size u 25 mm crochet hook finishing scissors turn work over to back make sure knots are tied securely weave ends in making sure they do no show on front instructions side carefully trim as needed you are now all set to cuddle up with your cozy cast - on chunky blanket make a slip knot with a tail of 6-8 inches and then pull the yarn through from the back to the front chain stitch 20 times you will have 20 chain stitches and one loop unwind a good bit of yarn from your skein to work with knitting set up the loop will count as the first stitch then with the yarn at the top of your chain pull the yarn from the back through a chain to create a new loop you now have 2 loops continue in this manner one at a time through all of your chain stitches you will have 20 loops when you are done with this row knitting the row - 20 stitches in each row note knit on the front side only row 1 - knitting
